alert.note: Alert for Gallia; Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 7:24PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Meigs, northeastern Gallia, north central Mason, northern Jackson and southwestern Wood Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 724 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rutland, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ripley, Pomeroy, Racine, Rutland, Forked Run State Park, Ravenswood, New Haven, Mason, Sandyville, Middleport, Chester, Syracuse, Hartford City, Cheshire, Portland, Lakin, Reedsville, Dyesville, Cottageville and Darwin. This includes Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 138 and 163. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
